conversation.ja_sentence: シモンズさん、建設的な批判はちゃんと受け取れますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: It will help me improve my work performance.
conversation.ja_sentence: 仕事の上達に繋がりますから。

conversation.en_sentence: That's why I am usually working overtime to compensate it.
conversation.ja_sentence: だから私はそれを補う為に残業しています。

conversation.en_sentence: I am pretty positive I do that just fine.
conversation.ja_sentence: ちゃんとしていると思っていたのですが。

conversation.en_sentence: I will try harder.
conversation.ja_sentence: 頑張ります。

conversation.en_sentence: They need to learn to become more productive members of this company too, right?
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼ら自身もこの会社の有意義なメンバーになる事を学ばないといけないですよね？

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for your advice.
conversation.ja_sentence: アドバイス有難うございます。

conversation.en_sentence: I am sorry I was busy helping my parents out.
conversation.ja_sentence: すみません、両親の手伝いをしていました。

conversation.en_sentence: I have heard about it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 聞きましたよ。

conversation.en_sentence: That's why I was helping my parents get some groceries and supplies.
conversation.ja_sentence: だから両親の買い出しの手伝いをしていたんです。

conversation.en_sentence: I figured we would not have to come in tomorrow.
conversation.ja_sentence: 明日は多分休みだろうなと思っていました。

conversation.en_sentence: I hope this storm will not be too bad.
conversation.ja_sentence: 酷い嵐でないといいんですが。

conversation.en_sentence: Is there anybody hunkering down at the office?
conversation.ja_sentence: 誰かオフィスに避難する予定ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: I can go check on the office after the storm passes.
conversation.ja_sentence: 嵐が去ったらオフィスの様子を見に行きますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I live only 5 minutes away.
conversation.ja_sentence: うちから5分しかかからないので。

conversation.en_sentence: The winds are picking up now.
conversation.ja_sentence: 風がだんだん強くなってきましたね。

conversation.en_sentence: Please tell Tadashi and Ashton to be careful.
conversation.ja_sentence: 忠さんとアシュトンさんにくれぐれも気を付けるように伝えて下さい。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for letting me know about tomorrow.
conversation.ja_sentence: 連絡どうも有難うございました。

conversation.en_sentence: Let's talk about the release date for our new product.
conversation.ja_sentence: では新商品の発売日について話し合いましょう。

conversation.en_sentence: When do you guys think we should do it?
conversation.ja_sentence: いつにしたら良いと思いますか？

conversation.en_sentence: I understand what you are saying, Mr. Kosaka.
conversation.ja_sentence: 小坂さん、気持ちはわかりますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: But it could be a good thing that Company D is releasing theirs first.
conversation.ja_sentence: でもD社の商品が先に発売されるのは良い事かもしれないです。

conversation.en_sentence: We could find out what the consumers think of it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 消費者がどう思ってるか知る事ができるでしょう。

conversation.en_sentence: And we could make adjustments based on their reviews.
conversation.ja_sentence: その評価次第で色々調整も可能でしょう。

conversation.en_sentence: Exactly!
conversation.ja_sentence: その通りです！

conversation.en_sentence: So when do you think we need to release ours?
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ販売日はいつにしたら良いでしょうか？

conversation.en_sentence: Sounds good to me.
conversation.ja_sentence: 良いと思います。

conversation.en_sentence: Do you agree on November, Mr. Kosaka?
conversation.ja_sentence: 小坂さん、11月で大丈夫ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Ok, November it is!
conversation.ja_sentence: では11月に決定です。

conversation.en_sentence: Before we wrap up this meeting, there is one more thing.
conversation.ja_sentence: このミーティングを終了する前にもう一つ良いですか？

conversation.en_sentence: You might know this already.
conversation.ja_sentence: もう知っているかもしれませんね。

conversation.en_sentence: Mr. Taniguchi is leaving at the end of this week to work for company A.
conversation.ja_sentence: 谷口さんがA社に転職するので、今週で退職するんです。

conversation.en_sentence: I figured you could give us a farewell speech here.
conversation.ja_sentence: この場で別れの挨拶をしてもらおうかなと思っています。

conversation.en_sentence: Of course, you have.
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろんそんな事ないですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, we are still in the process of hiring.
conversation.ja_sentence: 実はまだ探している途中でね。

conversation.en_sentence: You have been a valuable part of my company for so long, Mr. Taniguchi.
conversation.ja_sentence: 谷口さん、あなたは長年の間うちの会社の貴重な存在でした。

conversation.en_sentence: Selfishly, I do not want to let you go.
conversation.ja_sentence: 我がままに聞こえますが、本当は辞めて欲しくなかったです。

conversation.en_sentence: But you deserve your new job at company A.
conversation.ja_sentence: でもあなたはA社の仕事に相応しい人材です。

conversation.en_sentence: I wish you all the best of luck.
conversation.ja_sentence: 健闘を願っていますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Please stay in touch with us.
conversation.ja_sentence: これからも連絡して下さいね。

conversation.en_sentence: I have read them too.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私も読みましたよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Some of them are actually concerning.
conversation.ja_sentence: 注意した方が良さそうなものも幾つかありました。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, they are mostly about this particular product, K.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええっと、ほとんどが特定の商品Kについてです。

conversation.en_sentence: Many customers claim what we are selling is counterfeit.
conversation.ja_sentence: 多数の顧客が、うちが偽物を販売していると主張しています。

conversation.en_sentence: That's why I was shocked to see more than 10 customers with the similar complaints.
conversation.ja_sentence: だから、10件以上同じ様な苦情が出ているのは驚きました。

conversation.en_sentence: Those vloggers advertise this knock off product to their viewers.
conversation.ja_sentence: そのブロガー達が視聴者向けに偽物商品の宣伝をしているんです。

conversation.en_sentence: So customers unknowingly purchase this fake product believing it's authentic.
conversation.ja_sentence: だから顧客は知らずに、偽物を本物と信じて購入してしまうんです。

conversation.en_sentence: Consequently, our customers blame us for selling fake ones.
conversation.ja_sentence: その結果、我々が偽物を販売していると批難されるんですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Isn't it illegal to sell counterfeit products?
conversation.ja_sentence: 偽物を販売するのは違法じゃないんですか？

conversation.en_sentence: If so, we can take legal action.
conversation.ja_sentence: 違法ならば、法的措置を取れますよね。

conversation.en_sentence: Should we contact Company J?
conversation.ja_sentence: J社に連絡した方が良いですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Nice to meet you too Cheryl.
conversation.ja_sentence: はじめましてシェリル。

conversation.en_sentence: At my last position at Company A, I was responsible for developing and expanding new business opportunities with current and potential customers globally.
conversation.ja_sentence: A社での私の最後の役職では、現在および将来の顧客との新しいビジネスチャンスの開発と拡大をグローバルで担当しました。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, I'm not at liberty to say as I am under a non disclosure agreement, but I did win 126 percent of my goal.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええと、私は非公開協定を結んでおりますので、あまり自由には言えないのですが、私の目標の126パーセントには達しましたよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I trained several new employees on Company A products with an emphasis on best practices for selling.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、私は販売のためのベストプラクティスに重点を置いて、A社製品について何人かの新入社員を訓練しました。

conversation.en_sentence: One time, the orders were running extremely late.
conversation.ja_sentence: ある時、注文が非常に遅れていました。

conversation.en_sentence: A customer had ordered 27 pallets of Product A and there was an issue coming through customs.
conversation.ja_sentence: ある顧客が27個の製品Aのパレットを注文したのですが、税関で問題が発生しました。

conversation.en_sentence: The barge that had the shipment on it was stuck in Hong Kong for 16 days!
conversation.ja_sentence: 荷物を積んでいたはしけが16日間香港で立ち往生したのです！

conversation.en_sentence: First, I contacted the port authorities in Hong Kong.
conversation.ja_sentence: まず、香港の港湾当局に連絡しました。

conversation.en_sentence: I was able to confirm all of the shipping information, which helped speed up the process a bit.
conversation.ja_sentence: 出荷情報をすべて確認することができたので、処理が少しスピードアップしました。

conversation.en_sentence: Next, they told me since everything was confirmed, they could go ahead and inspect the shipment, but that would take another 24 hours.
conversation.ja_sentence: そして全てが確認できたので次の積荷の調査を進める事はできるが、それには今からさらに24時間かかると言われました。

conversation.en_sentence: Luckily, everything was fine and passed inspection and was able to be shipped to the customer here in the US.
conversation.ja_sentence: 幸いなことに、すべてが問題なく検査に合格し、米国内の顧客に出荷することができました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ボブ ジョンソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hello Nancy, nice to meet you.
conversation.ja_sentence: こんにちは、ナンシーさん、お会いできて光栄です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ボブ ジョンソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Please call me Bob.
conversation.ja_sentence: ボブと呼んでください。

conversation.ja_speaker: ボブ ジョンソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Pleasure to meet you as well, Tom.
conversation.ja_sentence: トムさん、お会いできてよかったです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ボブ ジョンソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for the meeting today.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日のミーティング、ありがとうございます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ボブ ジョンソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Some water would be just fine, thank you.
conversation.ja_sentence: お水をいただければ結構です、ありがとうございます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ボブ ジョンソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, we are looking for a retirement home in Miami.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、マイアミで高齢者向けホームを探しています。

conversation.ja_speaker: ボブ ジョンソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I believe you have a new development coming into the market next year in Key Biscayne?
conversation.ja_sentence: キービスケーンに来年販売が始まる新しい開発物件があると聞いているのですが。

conversation.ja_speaker: ボブ ジョンソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: We have just started looking into this for our retirement.
conversation.ja_sentence: 定年退職に向けて探し始めたばかりなんです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ボブ ジョンソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I will bring these home to discuss with my wife.
conversation.ja_sentence: これらを家に持ち帰って、妻と相談します。

conversation.ja_speaker: ボブ ジョンソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I will be in touch, thank you.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、また連絡します、ありがとうございます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ボブ ジョンソンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you so much.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございました。

conversation.en_sentence: Umm, no it's tomorrow.
conversation.ja_sentence: えーと、いえ、明日です。

conversation.en_sentence: You even accepted the meeting invite.
conversation.ja_sentence: ミーティング予約を承認してくださったじゃないですか。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I am serious.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、本当です。

conversation.en_sentence: What meeting is it?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何のミーティングですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, is that the one that the Tokyo office is working on?
conversation.ja_sentence: それは、東京オフィスが進めているやつですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Okay, I'll ask Company A if we can reschedule the meeting.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました、ミーティングをリスケできるかA社に聞いてみます。

conversation.en_sentence: What's your schedule like next week?
conversation.ja_sentence: 来週のご予定は？

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, me too.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私もです。

conversation.en_sentence: What about the other days?
conversation.ja_sentence: その他の日はどうです？

conversation.en_sentence: Alright, I'll ask Company A if they can accommodate the change.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました、変更が大丈夫かA社に聞いてみます。

conversation.en_sentence: It's okay, it happens.
conversation.ja_sentence: 大丈夫ですよ、よくあることです。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, your office was closer than I thought.
conversation.ja_sentence: 御社は思っていたより近かったですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: We're just two blocks down the street.
conversation.ja_sentence: ２ブロック先ですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: We'll let you start then.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、そちらから始めてください。

conversation.en_sentence: Not really.
conversation.ja_sentence: あんまり。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, I went to University A too.
conversation.ja_sentence: えっ、私もA大学に行きましたよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I majored in mechanical engineering.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私は機械工学を専攻しました。

conversation.en_sentence: And I also got my MBA at University A.
conversation.ja_sentence: A大学のMBAも取得しています。

conversation.en_sentence: It's really good.
conversation.ja_sentence: すごくいいですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: And it's close by so I'm not complaining.
conversation.ja_sentence: それに近いし、不満はないです。

conversation.en_sentence: I'd definitely recommend attending their information sessions.
conversation.ja_sentence: 是非ガイダンスに行ってみるのがおすすめです。

conversation.en_sentence: Not a problem.
conversation.ja_sentence: いえ。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I've confirmed it with Company A already.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、A社と確認とれてます。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, we are still scheduled for next Friday at 2 o'clock in the afternoon.
conversation.ja_sentence: ないです、来週金曜の午後2時からで変わりありません。

conversation.en_sentence: Did you have a certain agenda that you wanted to go over?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何か話し合いたい議題はありましたか？

conversation.en_sentence: I can do the company introductions for our side if you'd like.
conversation.ja_sentence: 良かったら、会社紹介はこちらでできますけど。

conversation.en_sentence: I have a standard company presentation that I usually use when introducing our company.
conversation.ja_sentence: 会社の紹介をするときにいつも使うプレゼン資料があるんですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Will there be anything else you want to talk about?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何か他に話したいことはありますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Okay, should I send Company A the meeting agenda then?
conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました、A社に議題を送っておきましょうか？

conversation.en_sentence: So we will start with company introductions, talk about the potential business opportunity, and see if they can introduce us to Company B.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、会社紹介から始めて、ビジネスチャンスについて話し合い、B社を紹介してもらえるか聞いてみるということで。

conversation.en_sentence: Okay, I will open the phone conference ten minutes before the meeting.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました、会議の10分前に電話会議をオープンします。

conversation.en_sentence: Just in case they have technical issues in trying to connect to the call.
conversation.ja_sentence: 接続する際に技術トラブルがあったりするかもしれないので。

conversation.en_sentence: Not a problem.
conversation.ja_sentence: 大丈夫ですよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ヴォーン ゴードン
conversation.en_sentence: Well I think they had a good point.
conversation.ja_sentence: えっと、彼らもいい指摘をしていたと思いますが。

conversation.ja_speaker: ヴォーン ゴードン
conversation.en_sentence: We do need to think about projections more carefully especially if you are planning IPO.
conversation.ja_sentence: 株式公開を計画しているなら尚更、予測をもう少し慎重に考える必要はあると思いますよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ヴォーン ゴードン
conversation.en_sentence: There are many other companies that have R&D.
conversation.ja_sentence: 他にも研究開発をやっている会社はたくさんありますよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ヴォーン ゴードン
conversation.en_sentence: They manage and so should we.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼らもきちんと管理しているのですから、うちもするべきです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ヴォーン ゴードン
conversation.en_sentence: There is always a way.
conversation.ja_sentence: 必ず方法はあります。

conversation.ja_speaker: ヴォーン ゴードン
conversation.en_sentence: I get the feeling that they are genuinely concerned, especially because they are seasoned players in the management field.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私には、とりわけ経営に関して経験のある人たちということで、彼らが本心で心配しているように思えるんですが。

conversation.ja_speaker: ヴォーン ゴードン
conversation.en_sentence: Their advice is pretty across the board solid, regardless of industry or size of company.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼らのアドバイスは、業界や会社の大きさを問わず、全体的にかなりしっかりしていますよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ヴォーン ゴードン
conversation.en_sentence: We can definitely use their insights.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼らの洞察は絶対役立ちます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ヴォーン ゴードン
conversation.en_sentence: I'm talking more about day-to-day management.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私は、どちらかというと、日々の経営について話しているんですよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ヴォーン ゴードン
conversation.en_sentence: They know best practice.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼らは最善策を知ってますよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ヴォーン ゴードン
conversation.en_sentence: They oversee enough companies to have enough insights on what work and what don't.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼らは十分な数の会社を監督してきたので、何がうまくいって何がそうでないかについて十分な洞察があります。

conversation.en_sentence: So this month, our actual is half of our projection.
conversation.ja_sentence: で、今月の実績は予測の半分なのですが。

conversation.en_sentence: This is due to the fact that we are bringing out a new version of our B2C product "H89", and we didn't want our customers to feel betrayed by offering them our current version.
conversation.ja_sentence: これは、我々の個人向け製品の新バージョン「H89」を発表することになっており、現バージョンを提供することで消費者が裏切られたと感じないようにしたかったのです。

conversation.en_sentence: So we stopped all advertising for the current "H89" until the new version is out, which is the end of next month.
conversation.ja_sentence: そこで、新バージョンが発表されるまで、つまり来月末までは、今の「H89」についての宣伝を全てやめました。

conversation.en_sentence: Well the economy is bad too.
conversation.ja_sentence: えっと、景気もよくないですよね。

conversation.en_sentence: And we didn't do enough to retain our current customers but at the same time failed to get new customers.
conversation.ja_sentence: それに、既存の顧客を維持するための取り組みが十分でなく、同時に新しい顧客の取り込みにも失敗しました。

conversation.en_sentence: So the low number is a reflection of that as well.
conversation.ja_sentence: なので、低い数字はその反映でもあります。

conversation.en_sentence: So I like to move onto approving next month's marketing budget.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、来月のマーケティング予算の承認に移りましょうか。

conversation.en_sentence: Although we are curbing exposure for the current "H89", we will be starting grass root word of mouth efforts for the new version and are also planning bus wrapping ads.
conversation.ja_sentence: 現在の「H89」の宣伝を控えているものの、草の根口コミでの新バージョンの売り込みを始め、バスのラッピング広告を計画しています。

conversation.en_sentence: The bus wrap is new, so next month's expenditure on advertisement will go over our projected budget.
conversation.ja_sentence: バスのラッピング広告は新しいことで、来月の宣伝費は予算見積もりを超えることになります。

conversation.en_sentence: We initially were not planning public transportation as an advertising medium.
conversation.ja_sentence: 当初、公共交通機関を宣伝方法として考えていなかったんですよね。

conversation.en_sentence: But we had some talks with consultants last month and decided it was a good move.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、先月コンサルタントと話をして、これはいい動きだと決めたんです。

conversation.en_sentence: The projection has already been approved by this board last year.
conversation.ja_sentence: 予測は去年役員会で承認されました。

conversation.en_sentence: There is no point in going over why something is not in the projection.
conversation.ja_sentence: 何かが予測に反映されていなかったことの原因を話すことは無駄です。

conversation.en_sentence: We will do better next year.
conversation.ja_sentence: 来年はもっとちゃんとします。

conversation.en_sentence: Mr. Ko, please move on, we don't have much time.
conversation.ja_sentence: 高さん、先に進んでください、時間がないので。

conversation.en_sentence: I apologize for cutting you short Alex.
conversation.ja_sentence: アレックスさん、話を遮ってすみませんでした。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, Mr. Colton, I believe there is nothing to worry about because the new version of "H89" will fly off the shelves, so to speak.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね、コルトンさん、新しいバージョンの「H89」はいわば飛ぶように売れるでしょうから、何も心配することはないと思っていますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: The new technology we have in there is one of a kind.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私たちの新技術は他に類を見ません。

conversation.en_sentence: We are in the process of patenting it.
conversation.ja_sentence: それを特許化する過程にあります。

conversation.en_sentence: I am very excited about all of this, and I am positive that our current hiccup will be remedied.
conversation.ja_sentence: これに関しては非常に楽しみで、今の一時的な問題も解決されると確信しています。

conversation.en_sentence: We are a small company so we have to move quickly and seize any opportunities.
conversation.ja_sentence: 小さい会社ですから、素早く動いて機会を捉える必要があります。

conversation.en_sentence: I made the decision but you have to remember we all make mistakes and learn from them.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私が決めましたが、誰でも失敗をしそこから学ぶことは覚えておいてください。

conversation.en_sentence: That was hard to sit through.
conversation.ja_sentence: あれは、じっと座ってるのが辛かったな。

conversation.en_sentence: They have been delusional for the past 2 years.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼ら、この二年間ずっと夢見てるよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I don't think anything is going to stop them now.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今は何も彼らを止められないと思う。

conversation.en_sentence: They are going to gun for that IPO unsuccessfully as long as this company is standing.
conversation.ja_sentence: 会社が存在する限り、成功しない株式公開を必死で目指すわよ。

conversation.en_sentence: You should be thinking about a backup, yes.
conversation.ja_sentence: バックアップ案を考えておくべき、ってことならそうだね。

conversation.en_sentence: The direction management is taking is just plain wrong.
conversation.ja_sentence: 経営陣の方向性は、単に間違ってるんだよな。

conversation.en_sentence: They started selling to the masses on a whim, and just because they had some moderate success 5 years ago, they think they can do it again.
conversation.ja_sentence: 思い付きで大衆向けに販売を始めて、５年間まあまあ成功したから、また出来ると思ってるんだよね。

conversation.en_sentence: You see these people have high IQs, but really low EQs.
conversation.ja_sentence: こういう人たちってIQは高いけど、EQは低いんだよな。

conversation.en_sentence: They can't put themselves in other people's shoes nor do they have perspective.
conversation.ja_sentence: 他の人たちの立場に立つってことや、他人の見方を理解するとかって出来ないんだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: That's all talk, which they are really good at.
conversation.ja_sentence: 口ばっかりだよ、それがとっても得意なんだよね。

conversation.en_sentence: They never really follow through.
conversation.ja_sentence: 行動が伴うことはないけどね。

conversation.en_sentence: I'd like to begin our weekly meeting.
conversation.ja_sentence: 週一の定例会議を始めたいと思います。

conversation.en_sentence: Solomon, can you start with your latest updates.
conversation.ja_sentence: ソロモンさん、最新の近況報告から始めてもらえますか。

conversation.en_sentence: Ok, so Solomon, you will talk to all of your clients who have purchased widget X2V and I will have a separate meeting about how to handle this with other customers.
conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました、じゃ、ソロモンさん、ウィジェットX2Vを購入した顧客全てに連絡してください、私は他の顧客の扱いについて別途で会議を開きます。

conversation.en_sentence: What are the other products this component was used for?
conversation.ja_sentence: この部品が使われた他の製品は何ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Who is in charge of those sales?
conversation.ja_sentence: これらの販売の責任者は誰ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: All right, can you set up a separate meeting with the 3 of us so we can go over this?
conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました、この件について話し合いたいので私たち３人の会議を別途に設定してもらえますか？

conversation.en_sentence: And I think it's better to have Mr. Ko sit in on that meeting too.
conversation.ja_sentence: それから、高さんにもその会議には出てもらうのがいいかと思います。

conversation.en_sentence: All right do we have anything else urgent from anyone?
conversation.ja_sentence: では、他に緊急事項はありますか？

conversation.en_sentence: I think I'll have to cut this meeting short because we have to deal with this ASAP.
conversation.ja_sentence: この件について出来るだけすぐに対処すべきなので、この会議は短めにすませましょう。

conversation.en_sentence: Anyone?
conversation.ja_sentence: 誰か意見は？

conversation.en_sentence: Ok, meeting adjourned.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、会議を終わります。

conversation.en_sentence: I've just finished off a report so I can help too.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私も報告書が今終わったとこなので手伝えます。

conversation.en_sentence: I think we should take out the drawers.
conversation.ja_sentence: 引き出しを出したほうがいいんじゃないかしら。

conversation.en_sentence: This is just too heavy to move.
conversation.ja_sentence: 動かすには重すぎますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Why does he have so much crumpled up paper?
conversation.ja_sentence: どうして、こんなにぐしゃぐしゃにした紙をとってるのかしら。

conversation.en_sentence: Can't he just throw them away?
conversation.ja_sentence: 捨てるってことができないんでしょうか。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, I know why it's heavy!
conversation.ja_sentence: あー、だからこんなに重いんだわ！

conversation.en_sentence: Look, he has so many rocks!
conversation.ja_sentence: 見てください、こんなにたくさんの石が！

conversation.en_sentence: Let's see.
conversation.ja_sentence: 見てみましょう。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh my gosh!
conversation.ja_sentence: うわー、何！

conversation.en_sentence: This is a mummified half eaten sandwich!
conversation.ja_sentence: ミイラになった食べかけのサンドイッチよ！

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, Taichi, you have a lot of explaining to do.
conversation.ja_sentence: あ、太一さん、色々と説明することがあるわよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I just passed Mr. Ko's office and he was chewing out our office manager.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今、高さんのオフィスの横を通ったら、うちのオフィスマネージャーをこっぴどく叱ってたんだけど。

conversation.en_sentence: Remember the move we did a couple of weeks ago?
conversation.ja_sentence: ２、３週間前にレイアウト変えたじゃない。

conversation.en_sentence: So, Mr. Ko didn't really think about the phone lines, so now the direct line to the lab is smack in the middle of the IT desk and it's really inconvenient.
conversation.ja_sentence: で、高さんは電話線についてあんまり考えてなかったみたいなんだけど、今、研究室への直通ラインがITデスクのど真ん中を通ってて、すっごく不便なんだよね。

conversation.en_sentence: I know, and some people aren't even allowed to see the intranet.
conversation.ja_sentence: 知ってるよ、イントラネットを見るのが許されていない人たちもいるよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Anyway, the IT guys can't move the phone line, so we needed to call in the phone company and since the seating arrangement is really weird now, they have to lift up the raised floors diagonally across our entire office.
conversation.ja_sentence: とにかく、ITの人たちは電話線を動かせないから、電話会社に連絡しなきゃいけなかったんだよね、で、今の席順が凄く変だから、彼らはオフィス全体のOAフロアを斜めに持ち上げてみないといけないんだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: They are fully booked Saturdays and Sundays until August so we are going to have to shut down the office for a full day next Thursday for them to fix the phone line!
conversation.ja_sentence: ８月まで、土曜と日曜は予約がいっぱいらしいから、電話線を直すために次の木曜、一日中オフィスを閉めないといけなくなったんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Not her fault at all but you know our management, it's never their fault.
conversation.ja_sentence: 全然彼女のせいじゃないじゃない、でも、うちの経営陣っていつもそうだけど、自分たちで責任はとらないんだよね。

conversation.en_sentence: She's the longest serving member in this office, besides the management.
conversation.ja_sentence: 経営陣の次に一番この職場に長くいるのは彼女だよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Hasn't she had enough?
conversation.ja_sentence: もう限界じゃないのかな。

conversation.en_sentence: She's really good at what she does so if she had a little more ambition, she will make more money elsewhere!
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼女、仕事がすごく出来るから、もうちょっと野心があれば他のところでもっとお金もらえると思うのに！

conversation.en_sentence: Well, I mean, you could?
conversation.ja_sentence: え、つまり、出来るかもってこと？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, what's up?
conversation.ja_sentence: うん、何？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Which service agreement are you talking about?
conversation.ja_sentence: どのサービス契約書のこと？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: The one with our subsidiary?
conversation.ja_sentence: うちの子会社とのあれ？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Oh okay.
conversation.ja_sentence: あ、分かった。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Can you send me a clean copy?
conversation.ja_sentence: クリーンコピー送ってくれる？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Like accept all the changes and turn off track changes.
conversation.ja_sentence: 変更部分を全部受け入れて、変更履歴追跡をオフにするんだよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: And convert it into a PDF file.
conversation.ja_sentence: で、PDFファイルに変換して。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Great.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとう。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Can you do that by noon today?
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日の正午までにできる？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I want to send it out by the end of today.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日の終わりまでに送りたいから。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you.
conversation.ja_sentence: 助かる。

conversation.en_sentence: Sure, what is it?
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、何ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Let's see.
conversation.ja_sentence: 見てみましょうか。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, in this case, it might be better to use the camera function.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね、この場合、カメラ機能を使うのがいいかも知れませんね。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, it's a function where you can turn a section of the sheet into an image.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、シートの一部を画像に変えることのできる機能なんです。

conversation.en_sentence: Once you can do that, you can enlarge or shrink that like an image.
conversation.ja_sentence: 一度そうすると、画像を拡大縮小することができます。

conversation.en_sentence: Like this.
conversation.ja_sentence: こんな風に。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, it's really useful if you have various charts on a page.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、一つのページに違う表がいくつもある時に便利なんです。

conversation.en_sentence: It's a hassle merging cells all the time.
conversation.ja_sentence: 常にセルを結合するのは面倒ですからね。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, just play around with it until you get the hang of it.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、慣れるまでしばらくこれで色々試してみてください。

conversation.en_sentence: Let me know if you have any other questions.
conversation.ja_sentence: また他に質問があったら聞いてくださいね。

conversation.en_sentence: If I can't answer it, I'm sure the internet can.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私が答えられないときは、インターネットが答えてくれますから。

conversation.en_sentence: I am bombarded with emails.
conversation.ja_sentence: Eメールに圧倒されてます。

conversation.en_sentence: Over a hundred in my inbox.
conversation.ja_sentence: 受信箱に100件以上もあって。

conversation.en_sentence: You already sorted your emails?
conversation.ja_sentence: ベンさんはメールの整理しましたか？

conversation.en_sentence: You sorted them during your break?
conversation.ja_sentence: 休憩中に整理したんですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Impressive.
conversation.ja_sentence: すごいですね。

conversation.en_sentence: By the way, how do you sort your emails?
conversation.ja_sentence: ところで、メールはどうやって整理してますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Do you have subfolders for each topic?
conversation.ja_sentence: 各項目にサブフォルダを作ってますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Down to the month?
conversation.ja_sentence: 月まで？

conversation.en_sentence: I might do that.
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕もそうするかもしれません。

conversation.en_sentence: I have been getting more and more emails.
conversation.ja_sentence: メールの数が増えるばかりなので。

conversation.en_sentence: Thanks for the advice.
conversation.ja_sentence: アドバイスありがとうございます。

conversation.en_sentence: Hello?
conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, hi Sam.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、やあ、サム。

conversation.en_sentence: That's good to hear.
conversation.ja_sentence: それは良かった。

conversation.en_sentence: So what can I help you with today?
conversation.ja_sentence: で、今日はどういった用件だい？

conversation.en_sentence: How many trucks do you need?
conversation.ja_sentence: トラック何台いるんだい？

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah that shouldn't be a problem.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、大丈夫だと思う。

conversation.en_sentence: I can have the trucks come pick up the goods in the morning.
conversation.ja_sentence: 朝トラックを送って物品を積みこむよう手配しよう。

conversation.en_sentence: No worries.
conversation.ja_sentence: 大丈夫。

conversation.en_sentence: That would be great.
conversation.ja_sentence: それだととても助かるよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Do you need help with anything else?
conversation.ja_sentence: 他には何かあるかい？

conversation.en_sentence: Have a good one.
conversation.ja_sentence: 良い1日を。

conversation.ja_speaker: ドン ピアースさん
conversation.en_sentence: Well I think we should leave it as is.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね、私は今のままで良いと思いますよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ドン ピアースさん
conversation.en_sentence: The market has been stable lately so I don't see the need to adjust it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 市場も最近安定しているので調整の必要はないと思います。

conversation.ja_speaker: ドン ピアースさん
conversation.en_sentence: Well, your customer has been helpful to our success.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね、あなた方のお客様には私たちの成功の為にお力添えをいただいていますしね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ドン ピアースさん
conversation.en_sentence: We could consider a slight discount I guess.
conversation.ja_sentence: 少し値下げを考えても良いかと思います。

conversation.ja_speaker: ドン ピアースさん
conversation.en_sentence: The exchange rate has been favorable for us as well.
conversation.ja_sentence: 為替レートもこの頃私たちにとって有利ですしね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ドン ピアースさん
conversation.en_sentence: Let me do some calculations on my side and I'll get back to you with a price.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私たちの方で計算して、価格をご連絡させていただきます。

conversation.ja_speaker: ドン ピアースさん
conversation.en_sentence: I should be able to get you a price tomorrow afternoon.
conversation.ja_sentence: 明日の午後には価格をお知らせできると思います。

conversation.ja_speaker: ドン ピアースさん
conversation.en_sentence: Will that work?
conversation.ja_sentence: それで大丈夫そうでしょうか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ドン ピアースさん
conversation.en_sentence: Great, I will get back to you on this then.
conversation.ja_sentence: よかったです、では後ほどこの件についてご連絡致します。

conversation.ja_speaker: ドン ピアースさん
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for your continued business.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今後とも宜しくお願いします。

conversation.ja_speaker: ドン ピアースさん
conversation.en_sentence: It's important to keep our long-time customers happy!
conversation.ja_sentence: 長年のお客様に喜んでいただくの大切なことですよね。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes?
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh okay.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、いいですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Let me just open it up now.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今ファイル開きますね。

conversation.en_sentence: How many copies do you need?
conversation.ja_sentence: コピーは何部必要ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Is black and white okay?
conversation.ja_sentence: 白黒でいいですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Alright.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました。

conversation.en_sentence: Sure.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Which meeting room are you in?
conversation.ja_sentence: どの会議室ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Okay.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll print them out and bring them over.
conversation.ja_sentence: 印刷してお持ちします。

conversation.en_sentence: Not a problem.
conversation.ja_sentence: 大丈夫ですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm okay.
conversation.ja_sentence: オーケーです。

conversation.en_sentence: Not so much.
conversation.ja_sentence: それほどは。

conversation.en_sentence: That sounds good.
conversation.ja_sentence: それはいいですね。

conversation.en_sentence: I would love to go.
conversation.ja_sentence: ぜひ行きたいです。

conversation.en_sentence: What's the reason for the visit?
conversation.ja_sentence: 訪問の目的は？

conversation.en_sentence: I think so too.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですよね。

conversation.en_sentence: Is that the real reason you want me to come?
conversation.ja_sentence: そっちの方が本当の理由なんじゃないですか？

conversation.en_sentence: That's true.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうですよね。

conversation.en_sentence: I've done that a few times and my notes looked like a mess.
conversation.ja_sentence: 何度かやったことありますけど、自分のメモはひどかったです。

conversation.en_sentence: That sounds good.
conversation.ja_sentence: それはいいですね。

conversation.en_sentence: Got it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 了解です。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yes?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何でしょう？

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Which one is this one?
conversation.ja_sentence: この製品ってどれですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Let me think.
conversation.ja_sentence: えーと。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: I'll check my inbox.
conversation.ja_sentence: 受信トレイを見てみます。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: I can't seem to find it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 見当たらないです。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: I do recall seeing it before though.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、前に見た覚えがあるわ。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Actually, I might've saved a hardcopy in the filing cabinet.
conversation.ja_sentence: あ、ファイルキャビネットにハードコピーをしまったかも。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Let me go check.
conversation.ja_sentence: チェックしてみるわ。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Voila.
conversation.ja_sentence: あった。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: Here we are.
conversation.ja_sentence: はいどうぞ。

conversation.ja_speaker: エレイン ヤングさん
conversation.en_sentence: You should scan it and make a copy of it.
conversation.ja_sentence: スキャンしてコピーしてね。

conversation.en_sentence: Hi this is Jim from the Shanghai office.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし、上海オフィスのジムです。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for sending us the offer earlier this week.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今週初めにオファーを送ってくださってありがとうございました。

conversation.en_sentence: I wanted to ask if you can negotiate the price with the customer.
conversation.ja_sentence: 客先と価格交渉できるかお聞きしたかったのです。

conversation.en_sentence: The price of eight hundred dollars per metric ton seems a bit higher than market price.
conversation.ja_sentence: １トンあたり800ドルは市場価格よりちょっと高めだと思うんです。

conversation.en_sentence: It's been about seven hundred dollars.
conversation.ja_sentence: だいたい700ドルです。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes it is US dollars.
conversation.ja_sentence: そう、米ドルです。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes I am aware.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、それはわかってます。

conversation.en_sentence: But the customer is complaining about the price so even a small discount will make them happy.
conversation.ja_sentence: ですが、客先が高いと言ってますので、少しでも値引きしていただければ、向こうも納得すると思います。

conversation.en_sentence: Do you think you can somehow get a discount?
conversation.ja_sentence: なんとか値引きできそうですかね？

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you very much.
conversation.ja_sentence: 助かります。

conversation.en_sentence: Bye now.
conversation.ja_sentence: さようなら。

conversation.en_sentence: Hi Elaine, can I ask you something?
conversation.ja_sentence: エレイン、ちょっと聞いてもいいですか？

conversation.en_sentence: I'm trying to send the original hard copies of this shipping document to my customer in China.
conversation.ja_sentence: この船積書類のハードコピー原本を中国の客先に送ろうとしているんです。

conversation.en_sentence: I know you usually use Company A or Company B but which one should I use?
conversation.ja_sentence: いつも、A社かB社を使っているみたいですが、どちらがいいですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah it is.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、そうなんです。

conversation.en_sentence: Okay.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい。

conversation.en_sentence: So I don't have to enter everything manually every time right?
conversation.ja_sentence: そうすれば、毎回入力しなくてもいいんですね。

conversation.en_sentence: Where is the envelope?
conversation.ja_sentence: 封筒はどこにありますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Oh it's okay.
conversation.ja_sentence: いえ、大丈夫です。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll figure it out on my own.
conversation.ja_sentence: 自分で探しますんで。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you so much for your help!
conversation.ja_sentence: ご丁寧にありがとうございました。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you!
conversation.ja_sentence: 助かります！

conversation.en_sentence: Hey Ben, can you check this email for me?
conversation.ja_sentence: ベンさん、僕の代わりにこのメール見てくれる？

conversation.en_sentence: It's for Company A.
conversation.ja_sentence: A社宛て。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm trying to find out if the offer price they sent me is negotiable or not.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼らの提示価格は交渉ができるものかどうか聞いてみたいんだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: But I don't want to come on too strong.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、押しが強すぎると思われたくないんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: So I should show them that I tried to accept their price by discussing it internally?
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃ、社内で話し合うという形で提示価格を受け入れようと努力したように見せるってこと？

conversation.en_sentence: Even if I didn't actually discuss it internally?
conversation.ja_sentence: 実際は社内で話し合ってなくても？

conversation.en_sentence: Alright.
